titles.title: To enhance fairness in compensating owners of patents used by the United States.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Intellectual Property and Judicial Administration.
Re-referred to the Subcommittee on Administrative Law and Governmental Relations.

bill.summary: 4/20/1994--Introduced. Amends the Federal judicial code to allow an owner of a patent that is used or manufactured unlawfully by or for the United States to be compensated for his or her reasonable costs in pursuing action against the United States in the U.S. Court of Federal Claims (in addition to reasonable and entire compensation).
